alert.note: Alert for Collier (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 16 at 9:29AM EST until January 16 at 10:15AM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Collier County in southwestern Florida... * Until 1015 AM EST. * At 928 AM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from West Toll Gate On Alligator Alley to Royal Palm Hammock, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Naples, Marco Island, Ave Maria, Golden Gate Estates and Immokalee. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into a small central room in a sturdy structure. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Miami. You can also share your report with NWS Miami on Facebook and Twitter.
